image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Gaza faces rising Polio outbreak risk amid war, aid groups push for ceasefire
item.description: The Gaza Strip faced a growing polio threat, with aid organizations calling for a pause in the ongoing conflict for vaccination efforts. A confirmed case and several suspected cases have emerged, with the virus detected in wastewater. Humanitarian groups emphasize the need for a ceasefire to vaccinate over 600,000 children and prevent an outbreak.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: DNC 2024: Harris, Walz set to accept nominations- All you need to know
item.description: The Democratic National Convention in Chicago will see Kamala Harris and Tim Walz nominated for the 2024 Presidential race. Key speakers, including Joe Biden and Michelle Obama, will address the attendees. The convention aims to galvanize support in battleground states, with Harris focusing on future-focused themes and the Democratic platform emphasizing progressive values.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Belarus deploys a third of its army to Ukraine border
Harris’ ex-BF to Trump: Mention my name again and get sued
Trump and Melania’s wealth: $635 million in assets, $7.4m from NFTs and substantial legal debts
item.description: Donald Trump's financial disclosures revealed diverse income streams, including real estate, cryptocurrency, gold bars and unique items like Bibles. He earned significant royalties from the Lee Greenwood Bible and book reprints. Melania Trump contributed through speaking engagements and NFT sales. Despite substantial assets, Trump faces significant legal debts from sexual abuse and fraud cases.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris arrives in Chicago to star at Democratic convention
Rights body slams attacks on those honouring Mujibur
Zelenskyy announces major gains in Kursk: Second bridge destroyed, forces advance; latest from Russia-Ukraine war
item.description: Ukrainian forces intensified their efforts in the Kursk region, destroying two Russian bridges to disrupt logistics. President Zelenskyy reported gains over 1,000 square kilometers of Russian territory. Meanwhile, Russian forces pushed toward Pokrovsk in Donetsk, leading to civilian evacuations as Ukraine bolstered defenses and called for faster allied support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rights group meets Yunus, seeks 'minority commission' to probe attacks on Hindus
Blinken in Israel as Netanyahu, Hamas trade blame over Gaza talks
Alain Delon, smoldering French film star, passes away at 88
China claims Philippine ship ignored warnings and 'intentionally collided' in South China Sea
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Early Bangladesh polls unlikely as Yunus says implement reforms first
item.description: Professor Muhammad Yunus pledged for free and fair elections in Bangladesh after completing vital reforms. He emphasized the necessity of election commission, judiciary, and administration reforms. Yunus criticised the previous government for rigging elections and suppressing democratic rights. International community's support was sought for creating a poverty-free, democratic Bangladesh while ensuring human rights and accountability.

item.title: 'I am much better looking': Trump disses Kamala Harris during Pennsylvania rally, crowd applauds
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump supporter Jake Paul calls New York a 'Dumba** Democratic city,' after being booed at Mike Tyson presser
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-Chicago probation officer kills daughter-in-law for custody of 4-year-old granddaughter
item.description: Kathleen Leigh, a former Chicago probation officer, fatally shot her daughter-in-law, Marisa Galloway, in Manhattan before committing suicide. New court filings suggest the act aimed to secure custody of Galloway's granddaughter for Leigh's son, Zachariah Reed, who has since cut off contact with Galloway's parents, sparking a legal battle over custody.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump's ex-bestie hits out at her, calls 'unpatriotic' for this reason
item.description: Melania Trump's former friend, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, who authored the New York Times bestseller Melania and Me: The Rise and Fall of My Friendship with the First Lady alleged that Donald Trump's wife was selling ornaments bearing resemblance to the Presidential Medal of Freedom -- on her site. Stephanie posted photo of the memorabilia on sale on Melania's site and claimed that the former First Lady altered the image of the Medal of Freedom.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Ukraine's primary task is to destroy Russian war potential, create buffer zone in Kursk': Volodymyr Zelenskyy
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy stated that Ukraine's military operations aim to diminish Russia's war potential by conducting maximum counteroffensive actions. Over the weekend, Ukrainian forces targeted and destroyed strategic bridges in Russia's Kursk region, disrupting Russian supply lines. Zelenskyy stressed the achievements in creating a buffer zone to protect Ukrainian communities from Russian shelling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delta Airlines attendant hits passenger 'unexpectedly' with loaded beverage cart
item.description: A Florida woman sued Delta Air Lines after a flight attendant allegedly injured her with a beverage cart on a Paris-New York flight. She claims negligence, citing inadequate staff training. Delta faces other legal issues, including a recent emergency landing due to contaminated food and a lawsuit over refunds after a technology outage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Mass killings in America' karma for 'murder of infants', says North Carolina Lt Guv Mark Robinson
item.description: North Carolina's lieutenant governor, Mark Robinson, during his gubernatorial campaign, has staunchly opposed abortion, likening it to slavery and calling it murder. Despite his harsh stance, he shared a personal story about his wife's abortion, advocating support for mothers. His views have sparked debate and critique from his Democratic opponent.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
